name: Showing Up, Turning In, and Coming Around Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: If Jack SHOWS UP at your house, he....
questions.explanation:
arrives there.

	He could also TURN UP at your house. That means the same thing.

goes to bed.

	You've probably heard someone say, "I've had a hard day. I think I'm going to turn in now."

questions.text: If Jack COMES THROUGH for you, he....
questions.correct: helps you when you're in trouble
options: finishes his chores and eats dinner with you
wakes up and says "Good Morning" to you
questions.explanation:
helps you when you're in trouble.

	Good friends usually come through when their friends need help.

questions.text: When Jill is UNDER THE WEATHER, she is....
questions.explanation:
sick.

	When a restaurant waiter says he is "snowed under," he means that he has so many customers that he can hardly do his job properly.

questions.text: Jack TURNS Jill DOWN. He tells her that....
questions.correct: he can't do her a favor
options: he'll come to her party on Saturday
questions.explanation:
he can't do her a favor.

	You can also turn down your bed: fold back the covers so you can climb into bed more easily.

questions.text: When Jill has to PUT UP with something, she must....
questions.correct: do it or let it happen even though she doesn't want to
options: tell someone something that is sure to hurt that person's feelings
make dinner for a very large group of people
delay a trip that she has been looking forward to
questions.explanation:
do it or let it happen even though she doesn't want to.

	Things people have to put up with include bad weather, colds, and bad dreams.

questions.text: When Jack PUTS something OFF, he....
questions.correct: says he will do it later
options: cooks a meal that doesn't taste good
questions.explanation:
says he will do it later.

	There's a saying that goes, "Never put off until tomorrow what you can do today!"

questions.text: Yesterday Jill PUT me DOWN. She said I was....
questions.explanation:
stupid.

	A put-down is an insult or a mean thing to say about someone.

conceited.

	Showoffs act like they think they are better than other people.

questions.text: When Jill HANGS OUT at my house, she....
questions.explanation:
spends time there.

	Other handy words and expressions that include prepositions include TAKE-OUT food (in England it's called TAKE-AWAY, as in "Chinese take-away"), UNDERTOW, THROUGHWAY, and "I'm FED UP! I've had enough!"
